q: On a conference call, Eric Schmidt said in his new job he will focus more on external issues, working with customers, partners and government.`` I believe Larry is ready,'' Eric Schmidt said. His ideas are very interesting and clever and it's time for him to have a shot at running this. ` completely rethink the minivan,' CEO says WINDSOR, ONTARIO- Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made.`` We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile.'' for a filibuster to continue. To do so, he has introduced a resolution to change the rules of the Senate.`` The minority must always maintain the right to continue debate,'' said Sen. Bernie Sanders Al Franken . But if the minority feels that strongly about an issue it should be their burden to continue that debate, not a supermajority's to end it. The change could return the Senate to the era of when filibusters were rare because Senators who wanted to continue the filibuster had to show up and stay on the floor of the Senate. more mature leader. Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google Inc. 's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google Inc. 's executive chairman. The changes will be effective April 4. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. Page praised Eric Schmidt , too.`` There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly,

Saying his`` heart was in Indiana,'' Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.
